intro: Pleurospermum erosa, commonly known as the rock everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its grayish-green, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its drought tolerance. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Pleurospermum erosa is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
